original: A list of top frequently asked  CCNA interview questions  and answers are given below.
result: Below is a compilation of some of the most commonly asked questions and answers for CCNA interviews.

original: Hub is a networking device that connects the multiple devices to a single network.
result: A hub is a device used to connect multiple devices to a single network for networking purposes.

original: A switch is a control unit that turns the flow of electricity on or off in a circuit.
result: A switch is a device that is responsible for regulating the flow of electric current in a circuit by either turning it on or off.

original: Hubs are used at the physical layer.
result: Hubs are utilized in the physical layer of a network.

original: Switches are used at the data link layer.
result: Switches operate at the data link layer of the OSI model, facilitating the efficient communication of data between devices on a network.

original: Transmission type can be unicast, broadcast or multicast.
result: Transmission mode can take the form of unicast, broadcast, or multicast.

original: Initially, the transmission type is broadcast and then is unicast.
result: At first, the mode of transmission is broadcast, but later on, it switches to unicast.

original: Hub has 4/12 ports.
result: The hub consists of four out of twelve ports.

original: The switch has 24/48 ports.
result: The switch comes with either 24 or 48 ports.

original: Collisions occur commonly in a Hub.
result: Collisions are frequently observed to happen in a hub.

original: No collisions occur in a full duplex switch.
result: A full duplex switch is designed in such a way that it prevents any collisions from happening.

original: Address used for data transmission
result:
One possible rephrased version could be:

The location or identifier utilized to send or receive information in a network or communication system.

original: Hub uses MAC address for data transmission.
result: The method employed by hubs for data transmission involves using MAC addresses.

original: The switch uses a MAC address for data transmission.
result: The MAC address is utilized by the switch to facilitate data transmission.

original: Electrical signal is a data transmission form of a hub.
result: An electrical signal serves as a means of transferring information in a network hub.

original: A Frame is a data transmission form of a switch.
result: A frame is a method of transmitting data utilized by switches.

original: It is a layer 3 device that connects the two different networks and identifies the network devices based on their IP addresses.
result: A Layer 3 device is commonly used to connect two networks together and can easily identify network devices based on their IP addresses.

original: It is a layer 2 device and determines the network devices based on their MAC addresses.
result: A switch is a networking device that operates at the second layer of the OSI model and uses MAC addresses to identify and connect devices in a network.

original: Router transmits the data in the form of packets.
result: The data is transmitted by a router through the use of small units of data known as packets.

original: Switch transmits the data in the form of frames.
result: The method used by a switch to send data is through the transmission of frames.

original: It uses an IP address for the data transmission.
result: The method of data transmission used by the system involves the use of an IP address.

original: It uses a MAC address to transmit the data.
result: The device uses a unique identifier called a MAC address for transmitting data.

original: Layer of OSI model
result: The OSI model consists of seven layers that define how data is transmitted over a network. Each layer performs a specific function and interacts with the layers above and below it to ensure that data is transmitted successfully.

original: It uses Layer 3 OSI model and layer is the network layer.
result: The protocol utilizes the network layer, which is the third layer of the OSI model.

original: It uses layer 2 OSI model and layer is the data link layer.
result: The switch operates at the data link layer which is layer 2 of the OSI model.

original: It uses a routing table for routes to move to the destination IP.
result: The mechanism employed by an IP protocol for directing data packets to their intended destination is accomplished through the use of a routing table, which maps out the paths that the packets should take based on their destination IP address.

original: It uses a Content address memory table for MAC addresses.
result: The device utilizes a table for MAC addresses known as Content address memory.

original: It is used for WAN and LAN networks.
result: This technology is utilized for both local area networks (LAN) and wide area networks (WAN).

original: It is used only for LAN networks.
result: This statement suggests that the usage of LAN networks is the only applicable scenario for this particular technology.

original: Router is used in a full-duplex mode.
result: The router is utilized in a manner that allows for simultaneous sending and receiving of data, also known as full-duplex operation.

original: A switch is used in half as well as in a full-duplex mode.
result: A switch has the capability to operate in both half-duplex and full-duplex modes.

original: Advantages of using Switches:
result: Benefits of utilizing switches:

original: Switches are used to receive a signal and create a frame out of the bits from that signal. The signals enable you to get access and read the destination address and after reading that it forward that frame to appropriate frame. So, switches are the significant part of the transmission.
result: Switches play a crucial role in the transmission process as they receive signals and convert them into frames containing bits. These signals allow switches to read the destination address and appropriately forward the frame. As a result, switches are essential for gaining access and reading data during transmission.

original: Routing is a process of finding a path to transfer data from source to destination.
result: Routing refers to the act of determining the optimal path for transmitting data between a source and destination.

original: Routing can be performed in a variety of networks such as circuit switched networks and computer networks.
result: Routing can be applied to various systems including computer networks and circuit switched networks.

original: In packet switching networks, routing makes a decision that directs the packets from source to the destination.
result: Packet switching networks rely on the process of routing to determine the path that packets should take from their origin to their intended destination. This involves making a decision about the most efficient route to take based on the network topology and other factors.

original: Routing makes use of a routing table, which maintains the routes of various destinations.
result: The process of routing involves relying on a routing table that keeps track of the paths to different destinations.

original: The devices known as Routers do the process of routing. Routers are the network layer devices.
result: Routers are responsible for performing the routing process and act as devices at the network layer level.

original: The router is a networking device which is used to transfer the data across the networks, and that can be wired or wireless.
result: A router is an essential networking tool that can be connected through cables or wirelessly. It facilitates the transmission of data over various networks.

original: Routers use headers and routing table to determine the best route for forwarding the packets.
result: The process of routing packets involves routers analyzing headers and referencing routing tables to identify the most efficient path for the packets to follow.

original: Router analyzes the data which is being sent over the network, changes how it is packaged and send it over the network.
result: The router is responsible for examining the information that is transmitted through the network, adjusting its format, and forwarding it to its intended destination.

original: Examples of routers are:
result: Here are some examples of what routers are:

original: VLAN is a custom network which is created from one or more existing LAN's. VLAN facilitates you to create a collision domain by groups other than just physical location while in conventional LAN domains are always tied to physical location.
result: A Virtual Local Area Network (VLAN) is a network configuration that is composed of one or more existing LANs. This type of network allows users to create a collision domain based on groups, rather than physical location. In contrast, traditional LANs are limited to specific physical locations.

original: HDLC stands for High-Level Data Link Control protocol. It is the property protocol of Cisco which is the default encapsulation operated with Cisco routers.
result: The HDLC protocol, or High-Level Data Link Control protocol, is a type of encapsulation used by Cisco routers as a standard. This protocol is unique to Cisco and is commonly used in data communication networks.

original: HDLC adds the information in a data frame that allows the devices to control the data flow.
result: The High-Level Data Link Control (HDLC) protocol includes additional data in a data frame that enables devices to manage the flow of data.

original: HDLC is a bit-oriented protocol that supports both half and full duplex communication.
result: The High-level Data Link Control (HDLC) protocol is a bit-oriented communication protocol that allows for both half and full duplex communication.

original: HDLC offers flexibility, adaptability, reliability, and efficiency of operation for synchronous data communication.
result: HDLC provides synchronous data communication with a range of benefits, including adaptability, flexibility, reliability, and efficient operation.

original: It supports both point-to-point and point-to-multipoint communication.
result: The communication system can support both point-to-point and point-to-multipoint transmissions.

original: It supports synchronous as well as asynchronous communication.
result: The communication technology provides both synchronous and asynchronous modes of communication.

original: It provides full data transparency, i.e., the output delivered has the same bit sequence as the input without any restriction.
result: The system ensures complete transparency of data by delivering output that exactly matches the input, without any limitations on bit sequence.

original: LAN switching : LAN switching enables the multiple users to communicate with each other directly. LAN switching provides the collision-free network and high-speed networking.
result: LAN switching facilitates direct communication between multiple users on a network, offering high-speed connectivity and a collision-free environment.

original: Following are the main advantages of LAN switching:
result: LAN switching has several benefits, including faster data transmission between devices, reduced network congestion, and enhanced security. With LAN switching, data packets are sent directly to their destination, which helps to reduce bottlenecks and improve network efficiency. Additionally, LAN switching allows for better control over network access, ensuring that only authorized users can access shared resources. Overall, LAN switching can greatly improve the performance and security of local area networks.

original: Reduced congestion and transmission delay
result: Decreased traffic buildup and a reduction in the time taken for data to travel from one point to another.

original: No single point of failure
result: The absence of any individual component or system that would cause a complete system failure is known as "no single point of failure."

original: Allows full duplex data transmission
result: Enables data transmission in both directions simultaneously.

original: DLCI  stands for  Data Link Connection Identifiers . These are normally assigned by a frame relay service provider to identify each virtual circuit that exists on the network uniquely.
result: DLCI is an abbreviation for Data Link Connection Identifiers. These identifiers are typically allocated by a frame relay service provider to give each virtual circuit a unique identity on the network.

original: These are the two major types of networks:
result: There are two primary categories of networks.

original: In a peer-to-peer network, 'peers' are the computers which are connected to each other through an internet connection.
result: A peer-to-peer network is comprised of computers that are linked together through an internet connection, and these computers are referred to as 'peers.'

original: The computer systems on the network without the need for any computer server.
result: The network's computer systems can function independently without relying on any computer server.

original: Therefore, the computer in P2P is a "computer server" as well as a "client".
result: In peer-to-peer (P2P) networks, the computer functions as both a server and a client. This means that it not only receives information from other computers but also shares its own resources with them.

original: Requirements for a computer to have a peer-to-peer network are the internet connection and P2P software.
result: To create a peer-to-peer network, a computer needs two main things: a reliable internet connection and software designed specifically for P2P networking.

original: Some of the common P2P software peers include Kazaa, Limewire, BearShare, Morpheus, and Acquisition.
result: There are several popular P2P software peers in the market, including Kazaa, Limewire, BearShare, Morpheus, and Acquisition.

original: Once we are connected to the P2P network, then we able to search the files on other people's computer.
result: When we are connected to a peer-to-peer (P2P) network, we have the ability to scan for files on other individuals' computers.

original: Types of a peer-to-peer network:
result: Peer-to-peer networks can be categorized into various types based on their functionalities, characteristics and capabilities.

original: In a server-based network, server act as a base for the network known as a central server.
result: A network that utilizes a central server as the foundation is called a server-based network. The central server serves as the hub for the network.

original: The central server handles multiple tasks such as authenticating users, storing files, managing printers, and running applications such as database and email programs.
result: The main server is responsible for performing various functions like verifying the identity of users, keeping files secure, supervising printing operations, and executing software applications like email and database programs.

original: In case of a server-based network, security is centralized in the system which allows the user to have one login id and password to log on to any computer system.
result: In a server-based network, security is concentrated in the centralized system. This allows users to have a single login ID and password to access any computer within the network.

original: Server-based networks are more complex and costly and often requires full- time services for administration.
result: Networks that are server-based are usually more intricate and expensive to set up, and may also require dedicated administration services to keep them running smoothly.

original: In server-based networks, the majority of traffic occurs between the servers.
result: The traffic in server-based networks is mainly focused on communication between the servers.

original: Following are the differences between public IP address and private IP address:
result: In terms of IP addresses, there are significant distinctions between public IP addresses and private IP addresses.

original: It is used for the identification of a home network to the outside world.
result: This term refers to the process of giving a name or label to a home network so that it can be identified by external entities.

original: It is used for the identification of a network device within the home network.
result: This statement means that the function of a network name is to recognize a device on a home network.

original: Public IP address is unique throughout the network.
result: Each device on a network is assigned a unique public IP address that differentiates it from other devices on the network. This address is specific to the device and is not duplicated within the network.

original: Private IP address can be the same of two different networks assigned to different computers.
result: It is possible for two different networks to have the same private IP address assigned to different computers.

original: It is used over the internet or other WAN.
result: This technology is employed for communication via the internet or other wide area networks.

original: This type of address can be used on a local area network or for the computers that are not connected to the internet.
result: An address of this type is applicable for computers that are not linked to the internet or for use on a local area network.

original: Public IP address is routable. Therefore, communication among different users is possible.
result: A public IP address allows communication between different users as it can be routed and accessed over the internet.

original: Private IP address is not routable. Thus, communication among different users is not possible.
result: A private IP address is not able to be routed, so it cannot be used for communication between different users.

original: Straight cable is used to connect different group devices. For example Switch- Router.
result: A straight cable is commonly used to connect various groups of devices, such as a switch and a router.

original: Straight cable is a kind of twisted pair cable used in a local area network to connect a computer to a network hub such as a router.
result: A straight cable is a type of twisted pair cable that is commonly used for connecting computers to network hubs such as routers in a local area network.

original: Straight cables are used for linking different devices.
result: Interconnect cables that have a straight configuration are typically utilized to connect various electronic devices.

original: It is an 8 wired patch cable.
result: This cable has a total of 8 wires in it and is commonly used as a patch cable.

original: It is also used for connecting PC to the switch or router to a hub.
result: The RJ45 Ethernet cable is commonly used to connect devices to a network, such as connecting a computer to a router or switch. It can also be used to connect a computer to a hub.

original: The main purpose of a straight cable is to connect a host to the client.
result: A straight cable is primarily used for connecting a host and a client in a network.

original: Cross cable is used to connect the same group devices. For example Switch-Switch.
result: A cross cable is utilized for connecting devices that belong to the same group, like two switches connected together.

original: Cross cable is a cable used to interconnect two computers by reversing their respective pin contacts.
result: A cross cable is a special type of cable used to connect two computers together by switching the pin contacts in a reversed order.

original: Cross cable is a cross-wired cable used to connect the two computers or hosts directly.
result: A cross cable is a type of cable that is wired in a way that allows two computers or hosts to be connected directly.

original: Cross cable is used when two similar devices are to be connected.
result: The cross cable is the type of cable used for connecting two devices that are similar in nature.

original: Cross cable crisscross each other, and this makes the communication of two devices at the same time.
result: A cross cable is designed to allow two devices to communicate with each other simultaneously by crisscrossing the wires.

original: Rollover cable is used to connect the console port to the computer.
result: A cable known as a rollover cable is utilized to establish a connection between the console port and the computer.

original: Rollover cable is used to connect the computer's terminal to the network's router console port.
result: A rollover cable is typically utilized to establish a connection between a computer's terminal and a router's console port within a network.

original: Rollover cable is referred to as a Cisco console cable, and it is flat and light blue in color.
result: A type of cable commonly used with Cisco devices is the rollover cable, also known as a Cisco console cable. This cable is flat and has a light blue color.

original: Another name of a rollover cable is Yost cable.
result: A different term used for a rollover cable is Yost cable.

original: Rollover cable is identified by comparing the end of the cable with another cable as rollover cables are beside each other.
result: To distinguish a rollover cable, one can compare the cable end with another cable. Rollover cables are located near each other.

original: Rollover cable allows the programmer to connect to the network device and can manipulate the programming whenever required.
result: A rollover cable enables the programmer to establish a connection with the network device and modify the programming as needed.

original: Differences between tracert and traceroute
result: Tracert and traceroute are two networking diagnostic tools used to track the path of an internet connection. However, there are differences between the two.

original: The tracert command is a command prompt command used to show the route that the packet takes to move from the source to the destination whatever we specify.
result: The tracert function is a command line tool that displays the path taken by packets as they travel from their source to their destination of choice.

original: The traceroute command is a command used to show the route from your computer to the destination that you specify.
result: The traceroute function is a useful tool that displays the path from your device to the desired location.

original: The tracert command is used on pc.
result: Tracert is a command used on personal computers for network troubleshooting and diagnostics.

original: The traceroute command is used on a router or switch.
result: The traceroute tool is executed on networking equipment such as routers or switches.

original: The tracert command is used in Windows NT based OS.
result: The tracert command is a utility tool used in operating systems based on Windows NT.

original: The traceroute command is used in UNIX OS.
result: The UNIX operating system uses the traceroute utility to trace the path of data within a network.

original: It specifies one to one communication.
result: The statement implies that the communication is limited to a direct exchange between two individuals.

original: It is a communication technique in which data communication takes place between two devices present in the network.
result: The process of exchanging data between two devices within a network using a specific communication technique is called Device-to-Device communication.

original: Consider an example of browsing the internet. When we sent a request for some page to the web server, then the request directly goes to the web server to locate the address of a requested page. Therefore, this is one to one communication between client and server.
result: An illustration of internet browsing is when a request is made for a specific web page, the request is sent directly to the web server to locate the page's address. This process involves one-to-one communication between the client and server.

original: Downloading the files from the FTP server is also the best example of unicast communication.
result: Using the FTP server to retrieve data is a prominent instance of unicast communication.

original: It specifies one to group communication.
result: The content is about a communication protocol that is designed for group communication.

original: It is a communication technique in which data communication takes place between a group of devices.
result: Group communication is a process where multiple devices exchange data with one another.

original: Multicast uses IGMP(Internet Group Management Protocol) protocol to identify the group.
result: IGMP (Internet Group Management Protocol) is utilized by multicast to recognize the group.

original: Consider an example of video conferencing. If any user in a particular group can initiate the call and the people belongs to this group can participate in this call.
result: An instance of video conferencing can be taken as an example. In a specific group, any member can start a call, and only those members who are part of this group can join the call.

original: Sending e-mail to a particular mailing group can also be considered as the example of multicast communication.
result: Multicast communication can be demonstrated by sending an email to a specific mailing group.

original: It specifies one to all communication.
result: The statement is referring to a communication standard that involves the exchange of information from one source to multiple recipients, also known as one-to-many communication.

original: It is a communication technique in which data communication takes place among all the devices available in the network.
result: The term "broadcasting" in networking refers to a method of communication where all the devices on the network are able to communicate and share data with each other.

original: By using a high-level standard, i.e., Message passing interface. It is an interface used for exchanging the messages between multiple computers.
result: The exchange of messages between multiple computers can be done through the implementation of Message Passing Interface (MPI). This is a high-level standard that enables the transfer of data between different computing systems.

original: By using a low-level standard, i.e., broadcasting through an ethernet.
result: To facilitate broadcasting through an Ethernet, a basic standard is employed at a lower level.

original: Network is not secure in broadcasting as it can lead to a data loss if intruders attack the network.
result: When network data is broadcasted, it can become vulnerable to potential attackers. This puts the security of the network at risk and could result in the loss of important data.

original: Cross cables are used to connect the same group devices while straight cables are used to connect different group devices.
result: Cross-over cables are designed for interconnecting similar devices, while straight cables are intended for linking dissimilar devices.

original: For example : If you want to connect one PC to another PC, you have to use cross cable while, to connect one switch to a router, you have to use a straight cable.
result: Consider the different types of Ethernet cables based on their wiring pattern. For instance, if you need to link two PCs together, then a crossover cable would be required, but to connect a router with a switch, a straight cable would be necessary.

original: Following are the differences between static IP addressing and dynamic IP addressing:
result: Static IP addressing and dynamic IP addressing are two ways of assigning IP addresses to devices. Static IP addresses remain fixed and don't change, while dynamic IP addresses are assigned temporarily and can change. These methods have distinct differences.

original: Static IP address is a fixed number assigned to the computer.
result: A static IP address is a permanent numerical identifier that is assigned to a computer.

original: The dynamic IP address is a temporary number assigned to the computer.
result: A dynamic IP address is a temporary numerical identifier that is allocated to a computer.

original: Static IP address is provided by ISP(Internet Service Provider).
result: The provision of a static IP address is typically offered by an Internet Service Provider (ISP).

original: The dynamic IP address is provided by DHCP(Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol).
result: DHCP or Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol is responsible for assigning a dynamic IP address to a device.

original: It is static means that IP address does not change.
result: In simpler terms, a static IP address is an unchanging and permanent address assigned to a device or computer on a network, as opposed to a dynamic IP address that changes periodically.

original: It is non-static means that IP address changes whenever the user connects to a network.
result: The characteristic of an IP address as non-static means that it is subject to change whenever a user is connected to a network.

original: It is not secure as IP address is constant.
result: Using an IP address as a form of security measure is not advisable as an IP address remains constant and easily traceable, making it vulnerable to potential security breaches.

original: It is secure because each time IP address changes.
result: The security of the system is ensured because the IP address changes every time.

original: It is costlier than Dynamic IP address.
result: Compared to a Dynamic IP address, obtaining a Static IP address is more expensive.

original: It is cheaper than the Static IP address.
result: A dynamic IP address is less expensive than a static IP address.

original: Static IP address is trackable as IP address is constant.
result: A static IP address can be easily traced because it remains constant and doesn't change.

original: The dynamic IP address is untraceable as IP address is always changing.
result: The dynamic IP address cannot be traced as it is constantly changing.

original: CSMA/CD  stands for  Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Detection . It is a media access control method used in local area networking using early Ethernet technology to overcome the occurred collision.
result: CSMA/CD refers to a media access control approach utilized in early Ethernet networks to handle collisions known as Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Detection. It aids in the resolution of collisions that occur during local area networking.

original: CSMA/CA  stands for Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Avoidance. It is used in the wireless network to avoid the collision.
result: Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Avoidance (CSMA/CA) is a protocol utilized in wireless networks to prevent collisions.

original: Following are the differences between CSMA/CD and CSMA/CA:
result: The following are the distinctions between CSMA/CD and CSMA/CA:

original: Full form of CSMA/CD is carrier sense multiple access with collision detection.
result: The complete expansion of CSMA/CD is carrier sense multiple access with collision detection.

original: Full form of CSMA/CA is carrier sense multiple access with carrier avoidance.
result: Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Carrier Avoidance (CSMA/CA) is an acronym that denotes a networking protocol technique. The full form of this abbreviation is used in networking and telecommunications fields to refer to a method of sharing a communication channel among several nodes in a wireless network.

original: CSMA/CD detects the collision, and once the collision is detected, then it stops continuing the data transmission.
result: CSMA/CD is a protocol used in Ethernet networks to handle collisions. When a collision occurs during data transmission, the protocol detects it and stops sending data, allowing other devices to transmit data instead.

original: CSMA/CA does not deal with the recovery of the collision.
result: CSMA/CA is a protocol used in network communication, but it does not handle the resolution of collisions.

original: Wired installation is used in a CSMA/CD to detect the collision.
result: Wired setup is utilized in a CSMA/CD to identify the occurrence of a collision.

original: Wireless installation is used in a CSMA/CA as it avoids the collision. Therefore, it does not need a wired network.
result: The use of wireless installation in a CSMA/CA protocol prevents collisions and therefore eliminates the need for a wired network.

original: An 802.3 Ethernet network uses CSMA/CD.
result: An Ethernet network that follows the 802.3 standard operates under the Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Detection (CSMA/CD) protocol.

original: An 802.11 ethernet network uses CSMA/CA.
result: An ethernet network that utilizes the 802.11 standard utilizes a technique called CSMA/CA.

original: CSMA/CD takes effect after the occurrence of a collision.
result: CSMA/CD is a protocol that comes into play once a collision has happened in a network.

original: CSMA/CA takes effect before the occurrence of a collision.
result: The CSMA/CA protocol operates to prevent collisions from occurring in a network before they actually happen.

original: The main purpose of the data link layer is to check that whether messages are sent to the right devices. Another function of the data link layer is framing.
result: The data link layer serves several purposes, including verifying that messages are directed to the proper devices. Additionally, this layer performs framing functions.

original: VLAN stands for Virtual Local Area Network.
result: VLAN is an acronym that stands for Virtual Local Area Network.

original: Subnets are used in IP network to break up the larger network into the smaller network. It is used to optimize the performance of the network because it reduces traffic by breaking the larger network into smaller networks. It is also used to identify and isolate network's problem and simplify them.
result: Subnets are an important feature in IP networks as they enable the division of a larger network into smaller segments. This is done to improve the network's efficiency and ease the identification and rectification of network issues. Subnets also help to reduce congestion by breaking the network into smaller, more manageable pieces.

original: Communication is a process of sending and receiving data from an externally connected data cable whereas transmission is a process of transmitting data from source to destination.
result: Communication refers to the exchange of information between two or more parties through a connected cable, while transmission is the process of conveying data from the sender to the recipient.

original: Topology is an arrangement of various elements (links, nodes, etc.) of a computer network in a specific order. These are the different types of topology used in CCNA:
result: The term topology refers to the structure or layout of a computer network. It involves how various components such as links and nodes are arranged in order to achieve efficient data transmission. In CCNA, there are several different types of topology that are commonly used.

original: Bus topology is a network topology in which all the nodes are connected to a single cable known as a central cable or bus.
result: A bus topology is a networking arrangement where the nodes are linked via a primary cable referred to as a bus or backbone. All the devices attached to the network only have access to this main communication pathway.

original: It acts as a shared communication medium, i.e., if any device wants to send the data to other devices, then it will send the data over the bus which in turn sends the data to all the attached devices.
result: The bus is a communication pathway shared by all devices connected to a computer, allowing them to transmit data to one another. Whenever a device wants to send data to others, it sends this data through the bus, which then distributes it to all connected devices.

original: Bus topology is useful for a small number of devices. As if the bus is damaged then the whole network fails.
result: The bus topology is effective for networks having only a few devices. However, it comes with a drawback that if the bus becomes damaged, the entire network will be affected and stop functioning properly.

original: Star topology is a network topology in which all the nodes are connected to a single device known as a central device.
result: A star topology refers to a type of networking structure where a central device is linked to all the nodes within a network. This design ensures that each node only requires a connection to the central device, rather than to multiple nodes.

original: Star topology requires more cable compared to other topologies. Therefore, it is more robust as a failure in one cable will only disconnect a specific computer connected to this cable.
result: The star topology is known for its reliability as it only disconnects a single computer connected to a failed cable, while the rest of the network remains operational. However, it requires more cabling than other topologies, making it a less cost-effective option for smaller networks.

original: If the central device is damaged, then the whole network fails.
result: In the event of the central device being impaired or dysfunctional, the entire network would cease to operate.

original: Star topology is very easy to install, manage and troubleshoot.
result: The installation, management, and troubleshooting of a star topology are simple and straightforward.

original: Star topology is commonly used in office and home networks.
result: A frequently used network topology in homes and offices is known as star topology.

original: Ring topology is a network topology in which nodes are exactly connected to two or more nodes and thus, forming a single continuous path for the transmission.
result: A ring topology is a type of network configuration where each node is connected to two or more nodes, forming a continuous path for data transmission. The connections are arranged in a circular shape, allowing for efficient and reliable communication between the nodes.

original: It does not need any central server to control the connectivity among the nodes.
result: The system operates without requiring a centralized server to manage the networking between individual nodes.

original: If the single node is damaged, then the whole network fails.
result: If there is damage to a particular node in a network, it can cause the entire network to fail.

original: Ring topology is very rarely used as it is expensive, difficult to install and manage.
result: Ring topology is not a popular choice due to its high cost, installation complexity, and maintenance difficulty.

original: Examples of Ring topology are SONET network, SDH network, etc.
result: Instances of a Ring topology include networks like SONET and SDH.

original: Mesh topology is a network topology in which all the nodes are individually connected to other nodes.
result: Mesh topology is a type of network topology that establishes a connection between all nodes present in the network. In this topology, each node has its individual connection with other nodes.

original: It does not need any central switch or hub to control the connectivity among the nodes.
result: A mesh network does not require a central switch or hub to manage connectivity between its nodes.

original: Fully connected mesh topology
result: A fully connected mesh topology is a type of network topology where all devices or nodes are connected to each other directly, forming a mesh-like structure.

original: Partially connected mesh topology
result: The partially connected mesh topology refers to a network design where some nodes in the network are only connected to a subset of other nodes in the network, creating a partially interconnected network.

original: It is a robust as a failure in one cable will only disconnect the specified computer connected to this cable.
result: Since only one computer is connected to each cable of a point-to-point cabling arrangement, it is a reliable option in case of cable failure as it will only disconnect the affected computer.

original: Mesh topology is rarely used as installation and configuration are difficult when connectivity gets more.
result: The utilization of mesh topology is infrequent due to complicated installation and configuration procedures that become more challenging as the number of connections increases.

original: Cabling cost is high as it requires bulk wiring.
result: The expense of cabling is significant since it necessitates the use of large amounts of wiring.

original: Tree topology is a combination of star and bus topology. It is also known as the expanded star topology.
result: The tree topology is a hybrid of the star and bus topologies, and is also referred to as the expanded star topology.

original: In tree topology, all the star networks are connected to a single bus.
result: The tree topology consists of several star networks that are linked to a central bus.

original: Ethernet protocol is used in this topology.
result: The network topology employs the use of Ethernet protocol.

original: In this, the whole network is divided into segments known as star networks which can be easily maintained. If one segment is damaged, but there is no effect on other segments.
result: The network is divided into multiple segments, commonly referred to as individual star networks. This segmentation allows for easier maintenance and management. Additionally, in the event that one segment becomes damaged or compromised, it will not have any impact on the other segments.

original: Tree topology depends on the "main bus," and if it breaks, then the whole network gets damaged.
result: The functionality of a tree topology is contingent upon the central bus, and in the event of its failure, the entire network will be adversely affected.

original: A hybrid topology is a combination of different topologies to form a resulting topology.
result: A hybrid topology is formed by combining various topologies to create a new topology with unique characteristics.

original: If star topology is connected with another star topology, then it remains star topology. If star topology is connected with different topology, then it becomes a Hybrid topology.
result: If a network topology called star topology is interconnected with another network topology that is also a star topology, it will still maintain its original configuration. However, if the star topology is linked with a different topology, it transforms into a hybrid topology.

original: It provides flexibility as it can be implemented in a different network environment.
result: The implementation of this system offers versatility since it can be applied in various network settings, providing adaptability to different environments.

original: The weakness of a topology is ignored, and only strength will be taken into consideration.
result: The focus is solely on the strengths of the topology, while its weaknesses are disregarded.

original: When the topology enables the computers on the network only to listen and receive the signals, it is known as passive topology because they don't amplify the signals anyway.
result: Passive topology is a type of network arrangement where computers in the network only have the capability to listen and receive signals. These computers do not amplify signals in any way.

original: RAID stands for Redundant Array of Independent Disks. RAID is a method which is used to standardize and categorize fault-tolerant disk systems. RAID levels provide various facilities like performance, cost, reliability, etc. These three are the mostly used RAID levels:
result: RAID is an acronym that stands for Redundant Array of Independent Disks. It is a technique utilized to establish fault-tolerant disk systems, with varying levels that provide benefits like performance, cost-effectiveness, reliability, and more. The three most common RAID levels are widely implemented.

original: Level 5: (Striping and Parity)
result: Level 5 refers to a data storage technique involving striping and parity. This method is used to improve data redundancy and fault tolerance in computer systems. Striping involves distributing data across multiple disks in a way that allows for simultaneous reading and writing. Parity is a method of error correction that involves using an additional bit to store information about the state of the data on each disk. Together, striping and parity help ensure that data can be recovered in the event of disk failure or other errors.

original: The point-to-point protocol is an industry standard suite of protocols which uses the point-to-point link to transport multiprotocol datagram. The point-to-point protocol is a WAN protocol used at layer 2 to encapsulate the frames for the data transmission over the physical layer.
result: The point-to-point protocol is an established set of protocols used for sending data packets over a point-to-point link. This protocol is designed for use in Wide Area Networks (WANs) and operates at the second layer of the network stack. It provides encapsulation for frames to ensure efficient data transmission over the physical layer.

original: Following are the features that point-to-point protocol provides:
result: The point-to-point protocol offers several features including...

original: The point-to-point protocol also provides authentication.
result: The point-to-point protocol offers a feature for authentication to ensure secure network communication.

original: It provides some essential features such as authentication, error detection, link quality monitoring, load balancing, compression, etc.
result: The protocol layer of OSPF is vital to the functioning of internet networks. Its key functions are to ensure secure access, detect errors, monitor link quality, maintain balanced load, and compress data.

original: Components of a point-to-point protocol are:
result:
Here's a possible rephrased version:

The point-to-point protocol consists of several components.

original: Simplex, half-duplex and full-duplex are the communication channels used to convey the information. Either the communication channel can be a physical medium or logical medium.
result: Simplex, half-duplex, and full-duplex are essentially different modes through which information can be exchanged between two communicating parties over a channel. The channel could be a physical medium like cables, fiber optics, etc., or it could be a logical medium like wireless communication.

original: These are the three possible ways of data transmission:
result: There are three methods for transmitting data.

original: The simplex communication channel sends the data only in one direction.
result: In simplex communication, data is transmitted in only one direction.

original: Example of the simplex communication channel is a radio station. The radio station transmits the signal while the other receives the signal.
result: A simplex communication channel is exemplified by a radio station, where the transmission of signals is done in one direction only, from the station to the receiver. In this scenario, the radio station sends out signals while the receiver merely listens or receives the signals.

original: In simplex mode, entire bandwidth can be utilized for the data transmission as a flow of data is in one direction.
result: Simplex mode allows for the full utilization of bandwidth during data transmission, as data can flow in only one direction.

original: The half-duplex communication channel sends the information in both the directions but not at the same time.
result: In a half-duplex communication channel, information can be sent in both directions, but not simultaneously.

original: Performance of half-duplex is better than the simplex communication channel as the data flows in both the directions.
result: Compared to simplex communication channels, half-duplex has a superior performance because it allows data to be transmitted in both directions.

original: Example of the half-duplex communication channel is "walkie-talkie". In "walkie-talkie", both the transmitter and receiver can communicate with each other on the same channel.
result: A common example of a half-duplex communication channel is the "walkie-talkie". This device allows both the sender and receiver to communicate with each other on the same channel at different times, but not simultaneously.

original: In half-duplex mode, entire bandwidth can be used by the transmitter when the message is sent over the communication channel.
result: When using half-duplex mode, the transmitter is able to utilize the entire bandwidth of the communication channel during message transmission.

original: The full-duplex communication channel can send the information in both the directions at the same time.
result: A communication channel that enables the transmission of information in both directions simultaneously is known as full-duplex communication.

original: Performance of full-duplex is better than the half-duplex communication channel as the data flows in both the direction at the same time.
result: Full-duplex communication channels outperform half-duplex channels due to their ability to simultaneously process data in both directions.

original: Example of a full-duplex communication channel is "telephone". In the case of telephone, one can speak and hear at the same time. Therefore, this channel increases the efficiency of communication.
result: An illustration of a communication channel that facilitates two-way communication is the telephone. The telephone permits individuals to talk and listen simultaneously, making communication more effective.

original: Protocol data units (PDU) are the minimum possible units used at different layers of the OSI model to transport data.
result: Protocol data units (PDUs) refer to the smallest units of data that are used to carry information across various layers of the OSI model.

original: Following are the differences between RIP and IGRP:
result: Here are the distinctions between RIP and IGRP:

original: RIP stands for routing information protocol.
result: The acronym RIP stands for Routing Information Protocol.

original: IGRP stands for interior gateway routing protocol.
result: The term IGRP refers to a routing protocol used within a network that is responsible for directing traffic.

original: RIP is a distance vector-based routing protocol.
result: The RIP protocol is a type of routing protocol that operates using distance vectors.

original: IGRP is a distance vector based interior gateway routing protocol.
result: IGRP is an interior gateway routing protocol that uses distance vector as its basis.

original: RIP depends on the number of hops to determine the best route to the network.
result: The RIP protocol evaluates the most efficient pathway to a network by analyzing the number of hops required to reach it.

original: IGRP considers many factors before decides the best route to take, i.e., bandwidth, reliability, MTU and hops count.
result: IGRP evaluates several factors before selecting the most optimal path, such as the bandwidth, reliability, maximum transmission unit (MTU), and number of hops.

original: RIP is a industry standard dynamic protocol.
result: The Routing Information Protocol (RIP) is a widely-used dynamic protocol in the networking industry.

original: IGRP is a Cisco standard dynamic protocol.
result: IGRP is a type of dynamic routing protocol that has been developed and approved by Cisco.

original: RIP is mainly used for smaller sized organizations.
result: The primary usage of RIP is limited to small-sized organizations.

original: IGRP is mainly used for medium to large-sized organizations.
result: IGRP is typically employed by businesses that are of moderate to significant size.

original: It supports maximum 15 routers.
result: It has the capability to accommodate a total of 15 routers at most.

original: It supports a maximum 255 routers.
result: The system has the capability to accommodate up to 255 routers.

original: RIP is denoted by 'R' in the routing table.
result: The routing table uses the abbreviation 'R' to indicate the Routing Information Protocol (RIP).

original: IGRP is denoted by 'I' in the routing table.
result: IGRP is identified by the letter 'I' in the routing table.

original: The administrative distance of RIP is 120.
result: To avoid plagiarism, I would rephrase the statement to say: The administrative distance assigned to the Routing Information Protocol (RIP) is 120.

original: The administrative distance of IGRP is 100.
result: One way to rephrase this content could be, "According to networking protocols, IGRP has an administrative distance value of 100."

original: RIP works on Bellman ford Algorithm.
result: The algorithm used in RIP is the Bellman-Ford Algorithm.

original: IGRP works on Bellman ford Algorithm.
result: Bellman Ford algorithm is the underlying principle behind the operation of IGRP.

original: Three types of memories are used in a CISCO router:
result: The CISCO router makes use of three distinct types of memories for its operation.

original: NVRAM stands for Non-volatile random access memory.
result: NVRAM is an acronym that stands for a type of computer memory known as non-volatile random access memory.

original: It is used to store the startup configuration file.
result: The function of NVRAM is to retain the initial configuration file of a system during startup.

original: NVRAM retains the configuration file even if the router shut down.
result: NVRAM is a memory storage component in the router that stores the configuration file persistently, even in case of power outages or shutdowns.

original: DRAM stands for dynamic random access memory.
result: DRAM is an acronym for dynamic random access memory, which is a type of random access memory used in modern computers.

original: It stores the configuration file that is being executed.
result: The configuration file that is being executed is saved in the cache memory.

original: DRAM is used by the processor to access the data directly rather than accessing it from scratch.
result: DRAM is a type of computer memory that allows the processor to quickly access data without having to retrieve it from scratch every time.

original: DRAM is located near the processor that provides the faster access to the data than the storage media such as hard disk.
result: The DRAM chip is usually placed close to the processor, enabling it to rapidly access data compared to the slower storage media, like hard disks.

original: Simple design, low cost, and high speed are the main features of DRAM memory.
result: The primary traits of DRAM memory are its affordable price, speedy performance, and no-frills design.

original: DRAM is a volatile memory.
result: DRAM is a type of memory that is temporary and loses its data when power is turned off.

original: It is used to store the system IOS.
result: The purpose of this storage component is to hold the IOS of the system.

original: Flash memory is used to store the ios images.
result: The storage of iOS images is done through the use of flash memory.

original: Flash memory is erasable and reprogrammable ROM.
result: Flash memory is a type of computer memory that can be erased and reprogrammed multiple times. It is often considered to be a type of read-only memory (ROM), as it is used to store data permanently, but can be updated or changed when necessary.

original: The capacity of the flash memory is large enough to accommodate many different IOS versions.
result: The flash memory has a high storage capacity and can store numerous versions of IOS.

original: Following are the differences between half-duplex and full-duplex
result: The following points highlight the contrasts between half-duplex and full-duplex communication.

original: Communication is bi-directional but not at the same time.
result: Communication involves a two-way conversation, although it does not happen simultaneously.

original: Communication is bi-directional and done at the same time.
result: Communication involves two-way exchange of information that happens simultaneously.

original: A sender can send as well as receive the data but not at the same time.
result: One can both transmit and receive data, but not simultaneously.

original: A sender can send as well as receive the data simultaneously.
result: Simultaneously sending and receiving data is possible for a sender.

original: Performance of half-duplex mode is not as good as a full-duplex mode.
result: Half-duplex mode does not exhibit the same level of efficiency as full-duplex mode.

original: Performance of full-duplex mode is better than the half-duplex mode.
result: Full-duplex mode has superior performance compared to half-duplex mode.

original: Example of half-duplex is a walkie-talkie.
result: A walkie-talkie is an example of a half-duplex communication system.

original: Example of full-duplex is a telephone.
result: A telephone is an example of a device that operates in full-duplex mode, meaning that it allows for two-way communication where both parties can send and receive information simultaneously.

original: BootP is a short form of Boot Program. It is a protocol that is used to boot diskless workstation connected to the network. BootP is also used by diskless workstations to determine its IP address and also the IP addresses of server PC.
result: BootP protocol is utilized to boot a workstation that has no hard disk attached to it via a network. It also allows diskless workstations to obtain their designated IP addresses as well as the IP addresses of the server PC. The term BootP is derived from the words "Boot Program."

original: Frame Relay is used to provide connection-oriented communication by creating and maintaining virtual circuits. It is a WAN protocol that is operated at the Data Link and physical layer to sustain high-performance rating.
result: Frame Relay is a wide area network (WAN) protocol that facilitates connection-oriented communication through the creation and management of virtual circuits. It operates at the Data Link and physical layer to deliver a high-performance rating.

original: How frame relay works.
result: Frame relay is a communication protocol that allows for the efficient transfer of data between multiple devices over a wide area network (WAN). It works by dividing data into smaller pieces called frames, which are then sent through the network using virtual circuits. This allows for faster and more reliable transmission of data, as well as greater control over network traffic and the ability to prioritize certain types of data.

original: Frame relay multiplexes the traffic coming from different connections over a shared physical medium using special purpose hardware components such as routers, bridges, switch that packages the data into a frame relay messages. It reduces the network latency, i.e., the number of delays. It also supports the variable sized packet for the efficient utilization of network bandwidth.
result: Frame relay is a networking technology that enables the sharing of a physical medium to transmit data from multiple connections. To achieve this, it uses specialized hardware components like bridges, routers and switches to package data into frame relay messages. The use of frame relay technology reduces network latency, resulting in fewer delays. Additionally, variable-sized packets are used to make optimal use of network bandwidth.

original: Latency is the amount of time delay. It is measured as the time difference between at the point of time when a network receives the data, and the time it is sent by another network.
result: Latency refers to the time delay experienced in data transmission. It is calculated by determining the difference in time between when the receiving network gets the data and when the transmitting network sends it.

original: MAC address stands for Media Access Control address. This is an address of a device which is identified as the Media Access Control Layer in the network architecture. The MAC address is unique and usually stored in ROM.
result: A MAC address is a unique identifier assigned to a device's Media Access Control Layer in network architecture. It is used to identify a particular device on a network and is typically stored in the device's ROM.

original: ARP  stands for Address Resolution Protocol. ARP is a protocol that is used to map an IP address to a physical machine address.
result: The definition of ARP is the Address Resolution Protocol. Its primary function is to accurately correlate an IP address to a physical machine address.

original: RAPR  stands for Reverse Address Resolution Protocol. RARP is a protocol that is used to map a MAC address to IP address.
result: Reverse Address Resolution Protocol (RAPR) is a networking protocol used to convert a MAC address to an IP address. It works in the opposite way of the well-known Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) which maps an IP address to a MAC address. RAPR is an essential component in establishing network communication, particularly in situations where a device's IP address is unknown, and the only available information is the MAC address of the device.

original: Following are the differences between ARP and RARP:
result: The following outlines the dissimilarities between ARP and RARP.

original: Full form of ARP is address resolution protocol.
result: ARP stands for Address Resolution Protocol.

original: Full form of RARP is reverse address resolution protocol.
result: RARP is an acronym for reverse address resolution protocol.

original: ARP contains the logical address, and it retrieves the physical address of the receiver.
result: ARP protocol works by mapping a logical address to its physical address counterpart. It retrieves the physical address of the intended receiver based on the logical address received.

original: RARP includes the physical address and retrieves the logical address of a computer from the server.
result: RARP is a protocol used to retrieve the logical address of a computer by providing its physical address to a server.

original: ARP is used to map 32-bit logical address to 48-bit physical address.
result: ARP is a protocol utilized in computer networking to associate a 32-bit logical address with a 48-bit physical address.

original: RARP is used to map 48-bit physical address to 32-bit logical address.
result: RARP is a networking protocol that is utilized to link 48-bit physical addresses to 32-bit logical addresses.

original: The size for IPv4 is 32 bits and 128 bits for IPv6.
result: IPv4 has a bit size of 32 while IPv6 has a bit size of 128.

original: PING stands for Packet Internet Groper. It is a computer network tool which is used to test whether a particular host is reachable across an IP address or not.
result: PING is a network tool used to verify if a specific host is accessible across an IP address. Its name is an acronym that stands for Packet Internet Groper.

original: The checksum is a simple error detection scheme in which each transmitted message is accompanied by a numerical value based on the number of set bits in the message.
result: The checksum is a method used for detecting errors in data transmission. It involves adding a numerical value based on the number of set bits in the message to the transmitted message.

original: There are five types of passwords can be set on a Cisco router:
result: The different types of passwords that can be established on a Cisco router are as follows:

original: Service Password Encryption command is used to encrypt all passwords on your router to hide from your running config.
result: The command "Service Password Encryption" is implemented to secure all passwords present in the router by hiding them from the running configuration.
